required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Behavioral Economics-Based Online Lifestyle Balance Program
clinical_study.official_title: Behavioral Economics-Based Online Lifestyle Balance Program

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this project is to design a Behavioral Economics Based Online Lifestyle Balance Program that employs behavioral economics to engage and motivate adherence to the Internet-based program. We compare the effects of two financial incentives on inducing weight loss: a direct financial incentive for weight loss and a financial incentive for learning health literacy.

detailed_description.textblock: This project investigates whether participants in a online weight loss program can be induced to achieve weight loss using financial incentives. The study is a 3-arm RCT stratified by gender. The goal is to examine how overweight individuals respond to two different types of financial incentives. The first type of incentive, IW (incentive for weight loss), is a cash award of approximately $150 given for achieving 5% weight loss over 12 weeks. The second type of incentive, IE (incentive for education), is a $150 award for passing quizzes that test the participants' health literacy about weight loss and techniques required for maintaining a healthful lifestyle. We compare the effectiveness of IW to IE in promoting weight loss in overweight individuals and investigate whether the two incentives work equally well for men and women.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 3-arm RCT (Control, Incentive for Weight Loss, Incentive for Education) stratified by Gender.
study_design_info.masking_description: A participant knows only the information that is specific to his/her arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight Loss at the end of the weight loss program (at Week 13)
primary_outcome.description: Weight measured at the Week 13 weigh-in session. Weight measurements are taken by trained research assistants using digital scales.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight Loss at the end of the post-intervention period (Week 25)
secondary_outcome.description: Weight measured at the Week 25 weigh-in session. Weight measurements are taken by trained research assistants using digital scales.

arm_group.description: Participants are enrolled in a 12-week, self-administered online weight loss program. The program is delivered through 12 weekly sessions; each includes educational videos and a health literacy quiz. Each quiz contains 10 questions, and a quiz is considered "passed" when at least 7 questions are answered correctly. ALL participants are encouraged to follow the program, take the quizzes, and lose 5% of their baseline body weight by the end of the program. No financial incentives are given for losing weight or passing quizzes.

Same 12-week, self-administered online weight loss program as in the Control arm. Each participant is also given a $150 "Incentive for Education" for passing at least nine quizzes by the end of the program.
Same 12-week, self-administered online weight loss program as in the Control arm. Each participant is also given a $150 "Incentive for Weight Loss" for losing 5% of their baseline body weight.

intervention.description: A $150 "Incentive for Education" is given to the participants for passing at least nine quizzes by the end of the program
A $150 "Incentive for Weight Loss" is given to the participants for losing at least 5% of baseline weight by the end of the program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
BMI between 23 and 33
Exclusion Criteria:
History of diabetes History of significant cardiovascular disease Family history of artherosclerosis High blood pressure Significant lung disease

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in the research, after de-identification (text, tables, figures, and appendices).
